profileText: A Representative from Georgia; born a slave near Knoxville, Crawford County, Ga., March 3, 1836; self-educated; became a merchant tailor in Macon, Ga.; upon the readmission of the State of Georgia to representation was elected as a Republican to the Forty-first Congress and served from December 20, 1870 to March 3, 1871; was not a candidate for renomination to the Forty-second Congress in 1870; delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1880; resumed business in Macon, Ga.; died on February 4, 1901, in Macon, Ga.; interment at Linwood Cemetery, Macon, Ga.

note.content: Qualified under act of July 2, 1862, and took his seat January 16, 1871.
